Instructions.Text:
Welcome to the PART task battery.

All of the tasks have the same, simple objective: Compare two sounds and identify which one is "special".

In every task, four squares will emit a sound, one at a time.  Three of the sounds will be "ordinary" and one will be "special".  The "special" sound that you need to identify will always be one of the two in the middle.  The first sound and the last sound will be examples of the "ordinary" sound.

In the following quick example, the "ordinary" sound just is silence and the "special" sound is not.  After listening to all four sounds, tap on the square the "special" sound came from.
Next you will hear several sets of rapid clicks.  One set of clicks will be slower than the others.  Can you identify the slow set?

Good job.  Now we'll do a harder version.  Continue to identify the set of clicks with the larger gap.

This task will try to find the smallest gap you can hear, so if you're not sure, just guess.  When the program finds the smallest gap you can hear, it will automatically move on to the final part.

In the last task, you will be listening for a small amount of warping among noise.  As before, this warping will only be present in one of the center two sounds.

Can you identify the sound with the warping?

Here is a simple example.

Now you will do the complete task.  Like before, your goal is to identify the noise with the warping.

This test will try to find the smallest warping you can hear, so if you are unsure which choice had the warping, just submit a guess.  When the program finds the smallest warping you can hear, the test will repeat once more, and then it will end.

Now we will try something a little different with the same sounds.

If the ripple is Rising, drag the top card Upwards.
If the ripple is Falling, drag it Downwards.

You will occasionally see special Blue and Green cards, that will remind you what the new Up and Down ripples sound like.

Now you will hear simple instructions about a Color and a Number.

They will all say "Ready Charlie, Go to " followed by a Color and a Number.

Press the button of that color and number.

Now there will be several voices.

Only follow the directions addressed to "Charlie".

Good Luck!

Congratulations!

You are finished with the PART battery.
